meanings.definition: A solid object with six square faces of equal size.
meanings.sent1: The ice tray makes small cubes for our drinks.
meanings.sent2: She counted the cubes on each side of the block.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten bats at the falling cubes.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a jumble of colorful cubes, each representing a different idea.
meanings.sent5: The child stacked the colorful cubes into a tall tower.

meanings.sent1: She carefully cubes the cheese for the salad.
meanings.sent2: The chef cubes the vegetables before adding them to the stir-fry.
meanings.sent3: He cubes the paper into tiny squares for his art project.
meanings.sent4: The sculptor cubes the clay to create intricate patterns.
meanings.sent5: The gardener cubes the soil to prepare for planting.

meanings.definition: A small cube-shaped piece of food.
meanings.sent1: She popped a cube of cheese into her mouth.
meanings.sent2: The recipe calls for adding two cubes of sugar to the tea.
meanings.sent3: The toddler happily munches on the soft cubes of fruit.
meanings.sent4: The waiter served a platter of assorted cheese cubes.
meanings.sent5: The party snacks included bite-sized cubes of ham.

meanings.definition: A number raised to the third power.
meanings.sent1: The math problem required finding the cubes of the given numbers.
meanings.sent2: He calculated the cubes of the first ten natural numbers.
meanings.sent3: The student struggled with understanding the concept of cubes in math class.
meanings.sent4: The scientist used cubes to represent volume in the experiment.
meanings.sent5: The architect used cubes to design the building's structure.
